article_title: Intel to Sell Online-TV Unit to Verizon
article_text:
Verizon Communications Inc. completed a long-awaited deal to buy Intel Corp.'s fledgling Internet-TV service, a diversion from computer chips that fell victim to changing management priorities.

Financial terms weren't disclosed, but people familiar with the matter put the price around $200 million.

The Intel Media unit has been developing a service called OnCue, which lets users watch live and on-demand programming over the...
